results.definition: take charge of or deal with
examples: Could you see about lunch?

results.definition: make sense of; assign a meaning to
examples: What message do you see in this letter?

results.definition: go to see a place, as for entertainment
examples: We went to see the Eiffel Tower in the morning

results.definition: see or watch
examples: This program will be seen all over the world
see a movie

results.definition: get to know or become aware of, usually accidentally
examples: I see that you have been promoted

results.definition: date regularly; have a steady relationship with
examples: Did you know that she is seeing an older man?

results.definition: find out, learn, or determine with certainty, usually by making an inquiry or other effort
examples: I want to see whether she speaks French

results.definition: perceive or be contemporaneous with
examples: You'll see a lot of cheating in this school
I want to see results

results.definition: undergo or live through a difficult experience
be careful or certain to do something; make certain of something
come together
examples: I'll probably see you at the meeting
How nice to see you again!

results.definition: accompany or escort
examples: I'll see you to the door

results.definition: perceive (an idea or situation) mentally
examples: Now I see!
I just can't see your point

results.definition: imagine; conceive of; see in one's mind
examples: I can't see him on horseback!
I can see what will happen
I can see a risk in this strategy

results.definition: observe, check out, and look over carefully or inspect
examples: I must see your passport before you can enter the country

results.definition: deem to be
examples: I don't see the situation quite as negatively as you do

results.definition: deliberate or decide
examples: let's see--which movie should we see tonight?

results.definition: go to see for a social visit
examples: I went to see my friend Mary the other day

results.definition: go to see for professional or business reasons
examples: You should see a lawyer
We had to see a psychiatrist

results.definition: match or meet
observe as if with an eye
perceive by sight or have the power to perceive by sight
examples: You have to be a good observer to see all the details
Can you see the bird in that tree?
He is blind--he cannot see

results.definition: receive as a specified guest
examples: the doctor will see you now
The minister doesn't see anybody before noon

results.definition: see and understand, have a good eye
examples: The artist must first learn to see

results.definition: the seat within a bishop's diocese where his cathedral is located
